definition: Lu Ban, legendary master craftsman, called the father of Chinese carpentry
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
team/class/squad/work shift/ranking/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for groups
surname Ban

sentences.english: Participated in the field collection power plant first phase "Luban to reward" the engineering project construction.
sentences.chinese: 参加了田集电厂一期工程“鲁班奖”工程项目建设。

sentences.english: Please hold your ticket and check it through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 乘客们，鲁班路站到了，请手持车票经过闸机验票。

sentences.english: Legend lu's wife is a cunning workman cloud.
sentences.chinese: 传说鲁班妻子云氏也是一位巧匠。

sentences.english: In ancient times, Lu Ban was supposed to be a consummate master in construction and sculpture.
sentences.chinese: 在古代，鲁班被认为是一个完美的建筑师和雕刻师。

sentences.english: The hands of a potato farmer near Urubamba, Peru.
sentences.chinese: 乌鲁班巴附近的一，秘鲁土豆的农民手中。

sentences.english: Lu Ban was the originator of architecture.
sentences.chinese: 鲁班是建筑工匠的祖师。

sentences.english: In my opinion, it is Lu Ban.
The carpenter's square has made the work of craftsmen more convenient.
sentences.chinese: 鲁班尺的使用给工匠带来了极大的方便。

definition: Houyi, mythological Chinese archer whose wife was Chang'e
Cheng Yaojin (589-665), aka 程知節|程知节[Cheng2 Zhi1 jie2], Chinese general of the Tang dynasty
Sun Bin (-316 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
Nüwa (creator of humans in Chinese mythology)
Dharma, the teaching of Buddha/Bodhidharma
same as Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子 (369-286 BC), Daoist author
Zhong Kui (mythological figure, supposed to drive away evil spirits)/(fig.) a person with the courage to fight against evil

Diaochan (-192), one of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3], in fiction a famous beauty at the break-up of Han dynasty, given as concubine to usurping warlord Dong Zhuo 董卓[Dong3 Zhuo2] to ensure his overthrow by fighting hero Lü Bu 呂布|吕布[Lu:3 Bu4]
秦越人[Qin2 Yue4 ren2] (407-310 BC), Warring States physician known for his medical skills, nicknamed Bian Que after the earliest known Chinese physician allegedly from the 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4] era
Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1]
Athena
Ying Zheng (260-210 BC), personal name of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
Miyamoto (Japanese surname)
Huang Zhong (-220), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, portrayed as an old fighter
Nezha, protection deity
